page.title: 07Education in Rathmell.
page.content: For such a relatively small place formal education has been part of Rathmell life for over 300 years. One of the village's famous sons, Richard Frankland, founded {Rathmell {Academy in 1670.}It was the{first {Nonconformist Theological College in {England.}Some of the original buildings may still be seen today but they form a row of cottages. As for the children of the locality records show that money was made available{in 1716}for the local Vicar to pay{a teacher,}who was required to {teach reading free of charge}but pupils had to pay if they required tuition in writing or accounting. The{buildings}that are visible now date back to{1875. Extensions}and improvements were{opened in 1962 by {Lt.Col.Geldard}at a ceremony attended also by the Bishop of Bradford.
